alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Southern Columbia; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Gilchrist, west central Bradford, northwestern Alachua and south central Columbia Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking training thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Worthington Spring to 7 miles east of Bell. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. These storms have already produced 1 to 2 inches of rainfall, and another 1 to 2 inches is possible. A flood warning may be needed...continue to monitor. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Alachua, High Springs, La Crosse and Brooker. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Southern Columbia; Western Alachua
